intro: Sarcostemma pyrotechnicum, commonly known as the flame vine, is a climbing shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its milky sap is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Sarcostemma pyrotechnicum is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
